newsitem.title: GERMANY: German industry boosted by rise in June orders.
newsitem.headline: German industry boosted by rise in June orders.

text.p: Pan-German industrial orders rose 1.5 percent in June although eastern Germany continued to show weakness, the Economics Ministry said on Tuesday.
West German orders, showing increases across all manufacturing sectors, rose 1.7 percent, offsetting a 3.2 percent decline in orders in the former communist east.

Pan-German foreign orders rose 1.2 percent while domestic orders increased 1.5 percent. Consumer goods showed the most strength compared to May, rising 3.5 percent, including a 10.4 percent gain overseas. Domestic consumer good orders fell 0.6 percent.
Year-on-year, pan-German orders rose five percent in June, with west German orders up 5.2 percent and east German orders up 1.6 percent versus June 1996.
In the two-month period combining orders from May and June, pan-German orders rose 5.2 percent compared to the same period last year, as the strong dollar boosted foreign orders 12.7 percent.
Pan-German orders in May and June were up one percent from the previous two months.
In west Germany, consumer goods orders also led the way, climbing 3.7 percent month-on-month, as capital good orders rose 1.5 percent and intermediate goods orders rose 1.2 percent.
In the May-June period, west German orders for intermediate goods rose 9.2 percent, for capital goods 1.2 percent and consumers goods 2.2 percent compared to May-June 1996.
In the same period, East German orders for intermediate goods rose 19 percent compared to last year, while orders for capital goods fell 10 percent and consumer goods orders rise three percent.
